title: fix: plated hole pads now merge with traces on same net via centralized geometry logic
description: Summary Fixed critical bug where traces failed to merge with connected rectangular plated hole pads, causing separate shapes instead of continuous copper. Implemented by refactoring copper geometry handling to eliminate code duplication and ensure consistent net-connection behavior.  Changes New helper function: addCopperGeometryToNetOrProject() centralizes net-connected vs. unconnected copper geometry logic Refactored 10 handlers: All plated hole (4) and SMT pad (6) handlers now use standardized merging logic Bug resolution: Plated hole pads correctly merge with traces on same net instead of creating gapsoverlaps Test coverage: Added example04 test case demonstrating proper trace-pad continuity
body:
## Summary
Fixed critical bug where traces failed to merge with connected rectangular plated hole pads, causing separate shapes instead of continuous copper. Implemented by refactoring copper geometry handling to eliminate code duplication and ensure consistent net-connection behavior.
## Changes
- **New helper function**: `addCopperGeometryToNetOrProject()` centralizes net-connected vs. unconnected copper geometry logic
- **Refactored 10 handlers**: All plated hole (4) and SMT pad (6) handlers now use standardized merging logic  
- **Bug resolution**: Plated hole pads correctly merge with traces on same net instead of creating gaps/overlaps
- **Test coverage**: Added example04 test case demonstrating proper trace-pad continuity

title: Add SVG snapshots and tests for mounted PCB modules
description: Adds a new mountedpcbmodule footprint generator with customizable pin and hole arrangements, and comprehensive automated tests for SVG output verification.
body:
This pull request introduces a new `mountedpcbmodule` footprint generator, adds it to the exports, and provides comprehensive automated tests to verify its behavior. The main focus is on supporting flexible PCB module mounting patterns with customizable pin and hole arrangements, and ensuring correctness through snapshot-based SVG testing.

**Key changes include:**

### Feature: New Footprint Generator

- Added a new `mountedpcbmodule` function in `src/fn/mountedpcbmodule.ts`, which generates a customizable PCB module footprint with support for various pin arrangements, mounting holes, silkscreen options, and both through-hole and SMD configurations. The implementation uses a Zod schema for parameter validation and transformation, and outputs a circuit JSON structure.

- Exported the new `mountedpcbmodule` function from the main index (`src/fn/index.ts`) to make it available for use throughout the codebase.

### Testing: Automated Snapshot Tests

- Added several new test files (e.g., `mountedpcbmodule_default.test.ts`, `mountedpcbmodule_example.test.ts`, `mountedpcbmodule_pinrow10_holexdist_holeydist_pinrowbottom_pinrowfemale_rows2_holes.test.ts`, etc.) that generate footprints using the new `mountedpcbmodule` function and verify the resulting SVG output against stored snapshots. This ensures the generator works as expected for a variety of configurations. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-1beed0596143f00617ada8267907cbc7d90bce2b4283410688469fd0822948dbR1-R12) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-2b122044b38f9cde4ef427526ff11bade6ef89acec13dfd40bb3471fbab5d311R1-R16) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-df4ba60132226f554614ad54a1c3129bdeb0c135cd94d71d196d7daa591ae721R1-R15) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-4b6e1c6e9614bf763dc69a4915ee54046f94e15bb5cb92ca4712af4228c90e60R1-R16) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-32829235b6f4adb02fd43bcddb8a3516fb683dcf78b18b8af7af963febe9ebf8R1-R13) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-b1df9ed0c35ed170e3d13e7b2be8decc296766570aa3d4bbb118586475c7a337R1-R14)

title: feat: support resistor array naming without underscores (e.g. 1206x4)
description: Adds support for resistor array naming conventions that use x instead of underscores, allowing for formats like 1206x4.

title: refactor: update type definitions and improve code clarity across multiple files
description: Refactors type definitions and improves code clarity by updating type imports, refining numeric constant usage, and cleaning up function logic across multiple helper files.
body:
This pull request focuses on improving type safety, consistency, and code clarity in several helper files. The main changes include updating type imports, refining the use of numeric constants, and cleaning up function logic and options.

**Type and Constant Consistency Improvements:**

- Updated type imports in `src/helpers/apply-origin.ts` from `AnySoupElement` to `AnyCircuitElement` for improved accuracy and consistency throughout the file.
- Replaced uses of `Infinity` and `-Infinity` with `Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY` and `Number.NEGATIVE_INFINITY` for better clarity and type safety in both `src/helpers/apply-origin.ts` and `src/helpers/boolean-difference.ts`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-3ca0524c9a4bf88e3aa6d291c903b1933d30d091dc68fa3ec2837536181f1987L31-R34) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-dd93d7c4d8007051730c866f5e8a481f009b2bf34afc238cf421afbe04c434d3L371-R374)

**Logic and Code Quality Enhancements:**

- Fixed a logic block in `applyOrigin` by wrapping the `"pin1"` case in braces for proper scoping and clarity.
- Changed `isFinite` to `Number.isFinite` in a bounding box fallback check for improved reliability.
- Removed an unnecessary else block in `passive` and improved return structure for better readability in `src/helpers/passive-fn.ts`.
- Changed the type of the `layer` option in `silkscreenpath` to accept only `"top"` or `"bottom"` for stricter typing.

**Minor Cleanups:**

- Updated a warning log message for consistency in `src/helpers/boolean-difference.ts`.
- Changed a variable declaration from `let` to `const` for `resultPolygons` to reflect immutability in `src/helpers/boolean-difference.ts`.

title: Fix Soldermask Clearance for Polygonal Pads by Rendering Full Pad Outlines
description: Fixes soldermask clearance issues for polygon-shaped pads by rendering their full outlines, ensuring accurate fabrication and visual fidelity.
body: This change ensures soldermask textures correctly clear polygon-shaped pad outlines, not just circular holes. By rendering the full pad geometry into the soldermask cutout, the generated masks now accurately match complex pad shapes, improving fabrication correctness and visual fidelity for non-rectangular and custom pads. Before After https://3d-viewer-git-fork-abse2001-main-tscircuit.vercel.app/?path=/story/plated-holes-polygon-pads--polygon-pad-plated-holes-demo

title: Add support for pill-shaped plated holes with rectangular pads
description: Adds support for pill-shaped plated holes with rectangular pads, including validation logic and comprehensive test coverage.
body: Introduces full support for the PcbHolePillWithRectPad interface, enabling pill-shaped holes within rectangular copper pads with configurable offsets. Includes validation logic across geometry processing files and comprehensive test coverage in a dedicated Storybook story. This enhances the 3D viewer's compatibility with advanced plated hole configurations from circuit-json.

title: Refactored both Manifold and JSCAD implementations to rotate shapes at the origin before translating them to their final position
description: Refactors the Manifold and JSCAD implementations to ensure shapes are rotated at the origin prior to being translated to their final positions, improving the accuracy of shape placements.
body: https://3d-viewer-9n0t0f5zv-tscircuit.vercel.app/?path=/story/pcb-pill-non-plated-holes--pill-non-plated-holes Before After

title: Add preview circuit json endpoint and use it in view-package hook
description: Add a new API endpoint to retrieve a packages preview circuit JSON based on configuration, replacing hardcoded paths in the frontend with a dynamic approach that respects the packages configuration file.
body:
### Motivation
- Provide a single, config-aware way to locate a package's preview circuit JSON instead of probing hardcoded file paths in the frontend.
- Make the view-package page use the API to determine the correct circuit.json (respecting `tscircuit.config.json`) and fallbacks, matching real-server behavior.

### Description
- Add a fake API route `package_releases/get_preview_circuit_json` that locates a package release, reads `tscircuit.config.json` (if present) and attempts to resolve `previewComponentPath` or `mainEntrypoint` to `dist/{component}/circuit.json`, with fallbacks to `dist/index/circuit.json` and `dist/circuit.json`, returning `{ preview_circuit_json_response }`.
- Implement JSON parsing and normalization logic in the endpoint, returning whether circuit JSON was found and the resolved component path when applicable.
- Replace the previous frontend file-path probing logic in `useCurrentPackageCircuitJson` with a call to the new endpoint using release-aware query parameters (package name/version, package_id, package_release_id, is_latest), wired through `useAxios` and `react-query` and returning `circuitJson`, `isLoading`, and an `error` message.
- Add request/response TypeScript typings for the preview response and adjust caching/stale settings for the query.

### Testing
- Ran typecheck: `bunx tsc --noEmit` (succeeded).
- Ran formatter: `bun run format` (succeeded).

------

title: Fix clone file path handling for dist files
description: Fixes the issue where the clone command strips dist segments, causing files to be written to the package root instead of under dist.
body:
### Motivation
- The clone command was stripping `dist/` segments and flattening files to the package root, causing files like `/dist/index.cjs` to be written to the top-level directory instead of under `dist/`.

### Description
- Update path normalization to only strip leading slashes by using `fileInfo.file_path.replace(/^\/+/ , "")` so directory segments like `dist/` are preserved when writing files (change in `cli/clone/register.ts`).

### Testing
- No automated tests were run for this change.

------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_6968d485e6808327b786d0a90f39019c)

title: chore: bump version to v0.1.753
description: Automated package update

title: Handle binary package files during clone by using download endpoint
description: Updates the clone functionality to correctly handle binary package files by utilizing a dedicated download endpoint instead of assuming text content.
body:
### Motivation
- `tsci clone` previously assumed file content was returned as text and failed to restore binary files.  
- The registry exposes an `is_text` flag on `package_files/get` and a separate `package_files/download` endpoint for binary content, so the clone flow must use those to restore files correctly.

### Description
- Update the `package_files/get` response type to include `package_file_id`, `is_text`, and nullable `content_text` and read those fields.  
- When `is_text` is true and `content_text` is a string, write the file with `fs.writeFileSync(fullPath, contentText)`; otherwise call `package_files/download` with the `package_file_id` and write the returned `arrayBuffer` as a `Buffer`.  
- Preserve existing error handling and add a warning when a file has no content or cannot be restored.  
- Changes are contained in `cli/clone/register.ts` and only affect the clone file restore logic.

### Testing
- No automated tests were run for this change.

------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_6968d40852808327bdb2f74e3ecfd4a2)

title: Register Bun loader for static assets to prevent STEP files being parsed as TypeScript
description: Adds a Bun plugin to register static asset loaders for STEP and other file types, preventing them from being parsed as TypeScript and ensuring correct resolution during CLI execution.
body:
### Motivation
- STEP and other static asset imports from dependencies were being interpreted as TypeScript/JS and produced syntax errors at runtime; a runtime loader is needed so imports resolve to file paths instead of being parsed as code.

### Description
- Add `lib/shared/register-static-asset-loaders.ts` which registers a Bun plugin to `export default <absolute-path>` for known static asset extensions (including `.step`).
- Call `registerStaticAssetLoaders()` early in the CLI (`cli/main.ts`) so Bun resolves static asset imports during CLI execution.
- Add a regression test `tests/cli/build/build-step-assets-from-dependency.test.ts` that creates a fake `@tsci/adom-inc.library` package with a `.step` asset, installs `react`, runs `tsci export`, and asserts the export succeeds and the output file exists.

### Testing
- Ran `bun test tests/cli/build/build-step-assets-from-dependency.test.ts`, which passed (1 pass, 0 fail). 
- Ran TypeScript typecheck with `bunx tsc --noEmit`, which completed with no errors.
- Formatted code with `bun run format` (succeeded).

------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_6968371bd598832ebad5a88ea4c6c172)

title: feat: Implement percentage-based solder mask margin scaling with element-size proportional adjustments
description: Adds a solderMaskMarginPercent option for percentage-based solder mask margins that scale with PCB element dimensions, ensuring backward compatibility and clamping to prevent negative openings.
body:
### Summary
- Introduces solderMaskMarginPercent option for percentage-based solder mask margins that scale with PCB element dimensions (width, height, or diameter)
- Percent margin is additive to existing global and per-element absolute margins, with clamping to prevent negative soldermask openings
- Applied consistently across all element types: vias, plated holes, and SMT pads
- Backward compatible (defaults to 0%)
- Includes comprehensive tests and updated snapshots

title: feat: Add solderMaskMarginPercent support for advanced soldermask margin control
description: Adds support for the solderMaskMarginPercent option, enabling percentage-based soldermask margin adjustments in PCB design settings.
body: ### Summary: Implement support for the new solderMaskMarginPercent option introduced in circuit-json-to-lbrn v0.0.42, enabling percentage-based soldermask margin adjustments alongside existing absolute measurements. Changes: - Dependencies: Updated circuit-json-to-lbrn from ^0.0.39 to ^0.0.42 - Configuration: Added solderMaskMarginPercent: 0 and globalCopperSoldermaskMarginAdjustment: 0 defaults to workspace options - UI Enhancement: Added "Soldermask Margin Percent" numeric control in settings panel, supporting negative values for flexible margin adjustments Benefits: Provides PCB designers with granular control over soldermask openings using percentage scaling, improving precision for various fabrication requirements while maintaining backward compatibility.

title: Add support for rotated pill plated holes with rectangular pads
description: Adds comprehensive support for the new rotated_pill_hole_with_rect_pad plated hole shape across all rendering engines and visualization layers.
body: Adds comprehensive support for the new rotated_pill_hole_with_rect_pad plated hole shape across all rendering engines and visualization layers. Key Features: - Independent rotation support for pill-shaped holes (hole_ccw_rotation) and rectangular pads (rect_ccw_rotation) - Proper offset handling with rotation (hole_offset_x/y) - Consistent positioning between JSCAD and Manifold engines - Full integration with copper layers, soldermask, and trace textures Implementation: - JSCAD geometry generation with proper rotation transforms - Manifold 3D processing with equivalent rotation logic - Board cutting and copper plating geometry - Soldermask and trace layer rendering - Added demo story showcasing rotated pill holes This enables complex plated hole designs with both hole and pad rotations, maintaining visual consistency across all rendering modes. https://3d-viewer-1h9dnbstx-tscircuit.vercel.app/?path=/story/pcb-pill-hole-with-rect-pad--rotated-pill-hole-with-rect-pad-demo

title: Fix panel auto-layout repositioning of child groups in boards
description: Fixes positioning issues of child and grandchild groups in PCB designs during panel auto-layout operations by updating their coordinates when the parent board moves.
body:
Problem: When panel auto-layout repositions boards, child and grandchild groups within those boards remained at their original positions (typically center), breaking relative positioning in complex PCB designs.

Solution: Modified Board._repositionOnPcb() to also reposition child groups by updating their center coordinates in the database when the parent board moves. This ensures groups maintain their relative positions during panel layout operations.

Testing: Updated panel-packing-primitives.test.tsx to include nested group examples and verify correct repositioning with visual snapshot comparison.

Files Changed:
- lib/components/normal-components/Board.ts: Enhanced board repositioning logic
- tests/components/normal-components/panel-packing-primitives.test.tsx: Added comprehensive test cases and updated snapshot expectations

This change resolves positioning inconsistencies in panelized designs and improves reliability for complex circuit layouts.

title: better distribution of portpoints
description: Redistributes port points uniformly along the sides of nodes to optimize routing density and prevent congestion.
body:
/** Redistributes port points uniformly along the sides of nodes to optimize
 * routing density and prevent congestion.
 *
 * This solver:
 * 1. Classifies which side of a node each port point belongs to.
 * 2. Determines the "owner" node for port points shared between nodes.
 * 3. Evenly spaces port points along their assigned side.
 */

title: feat: add USB support to mounted PCB module with SVG snapshot tests
description: Adds support for specifying USB connector position and type on mounted PCB modules, along with a test to verify SVG output.
body:
This pull request adds support for specifying USB connector position and type on mounted PCB modules, and introduces a corresponding test to verify SVG output. The main changes include updates to the module schema, logic for resolving USB properties, and a new test case.

**Schema and Logic Updates:**

* Extended the `mountedpcbmodule_def` schema to support USB connector properties, including `usbposition`, side-specific booleans (`usbleft`, `usbtop`, `usbright`, `usbbottom`), and type-specific fields (`usbtype`, `usbmicro`, `usbc`). (`[src/fn/mountedpcbmodule.tsR79-R89](diffhunk://#diff-a9c7a9272a01d9c9a2cd519926a351e8baacedc43f26a815dfca442035dbcb29R79-R89)`)
* Updated the transformation logic to resolve the effective USB position and type based on the new schema fields, prioritizing side/type booleans over general fields. (`[src/fn/mountedpcbmodule.tsR99-R108](diffhunk://#diff-a9c7a9272a01d9c9a2cd519926a351e8baacedc43f26a815dfca442035dbcb29R99-R108)`)

**Testing:**

* Added a new test `mountedpcbmodule_usb_left_c` in `tests/mountedpcbmodule_usb.test.ts` to validate that the PCB SVG output reflects the correct USB position and type when specified. (`[tests/mountedpcbmodule_usb.test.tsR1-R9](diffhunk://#diff-3b6a744390cf77d69a824332321184e766e0125bb17fd8c2572df0fb47333a8eR1-R9)`)

**Code Organization:**

* Cleaned up and reordered imports in `src/fn/mountedpcbmodule.ts` for consistency and clarity. (`[src/fn/mountedpcbmodule.tsR1-R10](diffhunk://#diff-a9c7a9272a01d9c9a2cd519926a351e8baacedc43f26a815dfca442035dbcb29R1-R10)`)

title: feat:Implemented soldermask_margin_{left,top,right,bottom} for rect and rotated_rect SMT pads
description: Implemented soldermask_margin_left, soldermask_margin_top, soldermask_margin_right, and soldermask_margin_bottom for rect and rotated_rect SMT pads, allowing for positive and negative margin values to control soldermask coverage.
body:
implemented soldermask_margin_left, soldermask_margin_top, soldermask_margin_right, and soldermask_margin_bottom for both rect and rotated_rect SMT pads. These work exactly like the existing soldermask_margin, supporting both:

- Positive values: The mask extends beyond the pad (substrate cutout).
- Negative values: The mask is smaller than the pad (creating a "ring" or "frame" effect where the pad's edges are covered).

title: feat: prevent text selection on PCB preview canvas elements
description: Adds userSelect: none styles to SVG container divs, overlay info badges, and empty state elements in the PreviewCanvas component to prevent accidental text selection during pan and zoom interactions.
body:
## Summary
Added `userSelect: 'none'` styles to SVG container divs, overlay info badges, and empty state elements in the PreviewCanvas component to prevent accidental text selection during pan and zoom interactions, improving the user experience.

title: fix: Prevent SVG viewport reset when interacting with settings panel preserve zoom/pan state during PCB burn settings configuration
description: Fixes disruptive viewport resets in the SVG preview when interacting with the PCB burn settings panel, preserving user zoom and pan states during configuration changes.
body:
Problem: 
Users experienced disruptive viewport resets whenever they clicked buttons in the PCB burn settings panel. Any interaction with laser profile selectors, layer toggles, numeric controls (margins, spot size, etc.), or other configuration options would immediately snap the SVG preview back to its initial fit-to-viewport transform, completely discarding the user's current zoom level and pan position.
Root Cause:
The useSvgTransform hook in lib/hooks/preview-hooks.tsx was triggering transform resets on every SVG content change. Since the settings panel controls modify lbrnOptions which regenerate the SVG, each setting change caused an unwanted reset to the default fitted view.
Solution: 
Refactored transform initialization logic to distinguish between circuit file changes (which should fit) versus rendering option changes (which should preserve user state). Added circuitJson dependency tracking to only reset transforms when actual circuit data changes.

title: Auto-Place CAD Components on PCB Top/Bottom Surfaces Using Board Thickness Awareness
description: Implements layer-aware Z-positioning for CAD components to ensure accurate placement on PCB surfaces based on board thickness, centralizing positioning logic across multiple model formats and enhancing test coverage for panelization.
body:
This PR introduces layer-aware Z-positioning for CAD components, ensuring models are correctly placed on the top or bottom surface of the PCB based on board thickness instead of relying on raw Z values.

Key improvements:

Automatically offsets CAD models to the correct PCB surface using layer and boardThickness.

Centralizes and reuses adjusted positioning across STL, GLTF, STEP, JSCAD, and Footprinter models.

Adds a comprehensive Panel Core Storybook test covering panelization and multiple PCB primitives.

Tightens rectangle border-radius clamping to avoid edge-case geometry artifacts.

Updates tscircuit dependency to leverage the latest core improvements.

Impact: more physically accurate 3D PCB visualization, fewer manual Z tweaks, and improved reliability for panelized boards and mixed CAD sources.


https://3d-viewer-git-fork-abse2001-main-tscircuit.vercel.app/?path=/story/panel-core-test--panel-core-test

title: Fix Panel Soldermask and Cutouts in JSCAD by Normalizing Default PCB Thickness to 1.4 mm
description: Fixes a rendering bug in the JSCAD viewer by standardizing the default PCB thickness from 1.6 mm to 1.4 mm, ensuring consistent soldermask visualization across panelized boards.
body:
PR Description

This PR resolves a panel-level soldermask rendering bug in the JSCAD viewer caused by inconsistent default PCB thickness assumptions.

What changed:

Standardized the default PCB thickness from 1.6 mm â†’ 1.4 mm across:

BoardGeomBuilder

useManifoldBoardBuilder

JscadBoardTextures

createFauxBoard

Ensures panel boards, faux boards, and manifold/JSCAD geometry all agree on the same thickness baseline.

Why this matters:

The previous mismatch caused incorrect Z offsets in panelized boards, leading to visibly broken or misplaced soldermask layers in the JSCAD viewer.

Aligning the default thickness fixes layer stacking, cross-section math, and texture projection for panel soldermask rendering.

Impact:

Correct soldermask visualization in panel mode.

More consistent board geometry across JSCAD, manifold ops, and faux-board paths.

Eliminates subtle Z-fighting and layer drift caused by mixed thickness defaults.

This is a geometry-consistency fix with direct visual correctness impact on panelized PCB rendering.

title: refactor: add PanelBoardLayout render phase for earlier board positioning in panels + explicit layout mode
description: Adds a new PanelBoardLayout render phase that computes board positions before PCB rendering, ensuring proper transform-based positioning for boards inside panels and eliminating post-render repositioning issues.
body:
Summary
Introduces a new PanelBoardLayout render phase that computes board positions before PCB rendering, enabling proper transform-based positioning for boards inside panels. This architectural change moves panel layout logic earlier in the render pipeline, allowing board positions to be incorporated into the global PCB transform rather than being applied as post-hoc repositioning.
Key Changes
- New render phase: Added PanelBoardLayout phase that runs before PcbComponentRender, allowing board positions to be determined before any PCB elements are rendered
- Transform-based positioning: Boards now store _panelPositionOffset and incorporate it into _computePcbGlobalTransformBeforeLayout(), ensuring all child elements (primitives, footprints, traces) are correctly positioned via the transform hierarchy
- Props-based dimension detection: getBoardDimensionsFromProps() extracts board dimensions from props/outline/circuitJson before the database is populated, enabling layout calculations earlier in the pipeline
- Explicit layoutMode: Panel grid layout now requires layoutMode="grid" to be explicit, making behavior more predictable
- Removed post-render repositioning: Eliminated the _repositionOnPcb loop that moved elements after rendering, which was error-prone and caused issues with certain primitives
Impact
This fixes positioning issues with silkscreen lines, breakout points, fabrication notes, and other primitives inside panelized boards that weren't being correctly transformed. The change ensures all PCB elements respect the panel layout transform consistently.

title: Refactor PCB Rendering Pipeline: Deterministic Layer Ordering + Physically Correct Soldermask Engine + add showSoldermask flag to draw options
description: Introduces a dedicated soldermask rendering engine with correct positivenegative margin semantics. Reorders the entire draw pipeline to match real PCB fabrication layers (substrate  copper  soldermask  silkscreen  drills). Simplifies pad, hole, and plated-hole rendering by removing inline soldermask hacks and centralizing logic. Fixes long-standing visual inaccuracies for soldermask coverage, margins, and cutouts across all shapes. Updates snapshots to reflect physically accurate PCB output.
body:
Introduces a dedicated soldermask rendering engine with correct positive/negative margin semantics.

Reorders the entire draw pipeline to match real PCB fabrication layers (substrate â†’ copper â†’ soldermask â†’ silkscreen â†’ drills).

Simplifies pad, hole, and plated-hole rendering by removing inline soldermask hacks and centralizing logic.

Fixes long-standing visual inaccuracies for soldermask coverage, margins, and cutouts across all shapes.

Updates snapshots to reflect physically accurate PCB output.

title: Eliminate redundant SVG regeneration by caching LBRN/PCB inputs in workspace previews
description: Caches the last LBRN inputs and PCB circuit to skip SVG regeneration when switching views without data changes, avoiding unnecessary work by reusing existing SVGs while keeping loading state accurate.
body:
- Cache the last LBRN inputs and PCB circuit to skip SVG regeneration when switching views without data changes.
- Avoid unnecessary work by reusing existing SVGs while keeping loading state accurate.

title: Eliminate redundant SVG renders by scoping LBRN/PCB generation to active views
description: Generates LBRN and PCB SVGs only when their views are active, splitting preview rendering to avoid redundant work on every settings change while maintaining a unified loading state and reducing CPU load.
body:
- Generate LBRN and PCB SVGs only when their views are active.  
- Split preview rendering to avoid redundant work on every settings change.  
- Keep a unified loading state while reducing CPU load.
